info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 3 at 2:41AM PDT until July 3 at 4:45AM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave, southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino, and southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 445 AM PDT /445 AM MST/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 AM PDT /241 AM MST/, Heavy rain and thunderstorms continue early this morning. Storms are currently focused east of Laughlin / Bullhead City where Thumb Butte rain gage recently reported 0.75 inches of rain in 15 minutes. Heavy downpours are also ongoing closer to Golden Valley. Avoid low water crossings and regional drainages which are currently flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bullhead City, Laughlin, Katherine Landing, Searchlight, Topock, Highway 95 At Mile Marker 29, Needles, Big Bend Rec Area, Mesquite Creek, Mojave Ranch Estates, Mohave Valley, Oatman, Cal-Nev-Ari, Arizona Village, Highway 95 And I-40, Cottonwood Cove, Cottonwood Cove Campground, Golden Valley, Dolan Springs and Willow Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM PDT /445 AM MST/ EARLY THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Mohave, AZ; San Bernardino, CA; Clark, NV
